main_definition: A washer is a device or person used to clean objects by removing dirt, stains, or contaminants through the application of water and often soap.

meanings_and_examples.example: I loaded my white shirts into the washer to remove any dirt.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Person who operates a washing machine or does laundry
meanings_and_examples.example: My sister is always busy as she's a dedicated washer, making sure all our clothes are clean and freshly pressed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A play on words where 'washer' refers to someone who tries too hard to impress others
meanings_and_examples.example: His constant need for attention can be seen as a bit of a washer, always trying to stand out in every situation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression meaning an excessive focus on trivial matters instead of important ones
meanings_and_examples.example: He's so caught up with organizing his bookshelf by color that he could be considered a washer, missing the bigger picture.
